extensionDescription.message: Utility providing many operations on links and page URLs

customOps_description.message: Here you may view the predefined embedded link patterns and link types, and define your own. Contributions to either set are welcome. Please see $link$ for details.
customOps_description.description: This will contain a link. Just use the placeholder wherever the link needs to be, and see customOps_description_linkText to set the text of the link itself.

linkTypes_description.message: These define the types of links that are recognized, and the operations available on them. The export function uses only the types you select from the list (which is a multiple-selection list), or all custom types if you select none. The "decode parameters" option treats all substitutions as query parameters and decodes them accordingly (useful to recover form inputs).

fileReadFailed.message: The file could not be read.

invalidImport.message: The import file is not valid.

downloadsPermissionFailed.message: Failed to get permission, cancelling export.

descr-copyops.message: These will copy something into the clipboard.

descr-visitops.message: These will take you to some address.

mustHaveName.message: You must enter a name for this type.

mustHavePat.message: You must enter at least one pattern for this type.

mustHaveOps.message: You must enter at least one copy operation or at least one visit operation.

embeddedLinks_description.message: Here you can see the built-in patterns for recognizing embedded links, and add your own. "Regular" patterns are for encoded links (e.g. "https://www.google.com/" becomes "https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2F", which must be decoded again), while "no-decode" patterns are for links that appear as-is.

newTab.description: Appended to visit operations to form new visit operations that open a new tab instead of sending the current tab to the address.
